meanings.definition: The long threadlike part of a nerve cell along which impulses are conducted.
meanings.sent1: The axone carries messages from the nerve cell.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how the axone transmits signals in the body.
meanings.sent3: The axone decided to take a break from delivering messages.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an axone, always moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The axone, like a messenger, never stops delivering its important news.

meanings.definition: A long, slender projection of a nerve cell that conducts electrical impulses away from the cell body.
meanings.sent1: He learned about the axone in his biology class.
meanings.sent2: The axone helps in transmitting signals throughout the body.
meanings.sent3: The axone wore a tiny conductor's hat to conduct electricity.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas traveled along the axone of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The axone stretched out like a wire, carrying vital information.
